question: This state panel proposes 3-colour official state flag recently.
explanation: Karnataka committee to analyse possibility of a separate flag for the state has submitted a report, suggesting an official three-coloured flag to replace an unofficial two-coloured flag currently in use. In June 2017, Karnataka's Kannada and Culture department appointed a committee to study the possibility of having a separate flag for Karnataka. The committee was headed by G S Siddaramaya, chairman of Kannada Development Authority. This committee has recommended a flag in yellow and red colour, with white colour in the middle containing the state symbol.
